flawed_nl_solution:
The 6 T-shirts cost 6 x $8 = $<<6*8=84>>84.
The 4 sweaters cost 4 x $18 = $<<4*18=72>>72.
And 5 jackets normally cost 5 x $80 = $<<5*80=400>>400.
So, a discount of 1/10 x $400 = $<<1/10*400=40>>40 for the five jackets.
Thus, the selling price of the five jackets is $400 - $40 = $<<400-40=360>>360.
Hence, the total cost of all the items is $84 + $72 + $360 = $<<84+72+360=516>>516.
The sales tax is equal to 1/20 x $516 = $<<1/20*516=129/5>>129/5.
Therefore, Kevin has to pay $516 + $129/5 = $<<516+129/5=2709/5>>2709/5. including the sales tax.
